Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of chariot scene (hind legs and tails in added red of horses; reins and chariot with charioteer, missing only his head and dressed in red himation), to left; black on wall below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XXI, no. 15)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 396, no. B578)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1367) (phase 3)
